text: hello if you are in college or a recent
grad or stuck in life and don't know
what to do then take my advice in this
video teaching English or your native
language overseas is one of the best
opportunities for you to get paid to
travel the world I have made three big
decisions in life that have led me to
where I am today
the first was attending the University
of wisconsin-madison the second was
studying abroad in Prague in 2012 and
the most recent was moving to South
Korea to teach English as a fresh
college grad
teaching English has some incredible
benefits like a starting salary of
$2,000 a month
tax exempt free rent usually a
one-bedroom apartment reimbursed flights
round-trip from your home country
covered health insurance three to five
thousand dollars in bonuses after
completing your first year two weeks of
paid vacation free lunch every day
hanging out with awesome kids and of
course feeling like a celebrity
everywhere you go in town
I realized that $2,000 a month doesn't
sound like a lot but on top of the
amazing benefits it pretty much made me
live like a king it was all pocket money
during my 18 months in Korea I started
and grew my first travel blog I got a
black belt in Taekwondo
I became conversational in Korean I
partied every weekend in Seoul I ate
Korean barbeque three nights a week I
traveled to eighteen new Asian countries
and I still managed to save a bit for my
future there are three major
qualifications to teach English one you
must hold a passport from an
english-speaking country - you must have
any degree from a three plus year
University and three you must obtain a
TEFL certificate or teach English as a
foreign language which is a two to three
week online course that proves your
fluency in English for the next 30 days
I'm offering 35 percent off your temple
class on my blog so check the link in
the description and act quickly the
company my temple also helps you find a
job placement for free other important
notes if your native language is not
English then don't panic because you can
likely teach your language at a
university or private academy or if you
are fluent in English then you can land
a gig as a private tutor you can apply
to teach in hundreds of countries from
El Salvador to Mongolia to Oman but I
personally think South Korea offers the
best all-around experience and it's also
one of the most high paying and Seoul is
just amazing you don't need any prior
experience in teaching or knowing the
local language you will have a co
teacher who helps out with discipline
and translation issues there is no age
limit requirement once you've passed
college every school is different
there's public versus private urban
versus rural your principal will have
unique rules for you to follow as well
all of your questions and more can be
found in my blog post listed below so
please give it a read and also tag your
friends I made this video because I
truly want to help some of you who are
stuck in life and don't know what to do
so who's ready to get paid to travel the
world
I'm drew pinsky and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me
as I plan to visit every country in the
world
